verbose_text: We further studied the time course of Slit2, Slit3, and Robo1 mRNA levels in the nerve bridge by qRT-PCR, showing that Slit2 mRNA levels are low in the nerve bridge compared to intact nerve (0 days) from 4 to 14 days (XREF_FIG A), the period that regenerating axons cross the nerve bridge after mouse nerve transection injury, while both Slit3 and Robo1 mRNAs are upregulated in the nerve bridge from 7 days following injury (XREF_FIG B and 4C).
